detaileddescription.para: Activation by Personalization (ABP)
Over the air activation (OTAA) for versions 1.0.x
Over the air activation (OTAA) for versions 1.1.x
Pre-Stored Key
User Stored Key

briefdescription.para: ADR (Adaptive DataRate and Power Setting by LoRaWAN network)

detaileddescription.para: Consult LoRaWAN Specification 1.0.2 for more details. Note that Data Rates are different depending on the region version of the module. RFU = Reserved for Future Use (reserved by LoRa Alliance)

briefdescription.para: ADR (ADR MAX PWR, same as PWR_MAX)
US 902-928 Sub-Band 1, uplink channels 0 to 7 (902.3 MHz to 903.7Mhz, 0.2MHz steps) and 1 downlink channel (923.3 MHz)
US 902-928 Sub-Band 2, uplink channels 8 to 15 (903.9 MHz to 905.3Mhz, 0.2MHz steps) and 1 downlink channel (923.9 MHz)
US 902-928 Sub-Band 3, uplink channels 16 to 23 (905.5 MHz to 906.9Mhz, 0.2MHz steps) and 1 downlink channel (924.5 MHz)
US 902-928 Sub-Band 4, uplink channels 24 to 31 (907.1 MHz to 908.5Mhz, 0.2MHz steps) and 1 downlink channel (925.1 MHz)
US 902-928 Sub-Band 5, uplink channels 32 to 39 (908.7 MHz to 910.1Mhz, 0.2MHz steps) and 1 downlink channel (925.7 MHz)
US 902-928 Sub-Band 6, uplink channels 40 to 47 (910.3 MHz to 911.7Mhz, 0.2MHz steps) and 1 downlink channel (926.3 MHz)
US 902-928 Sub-Band 7, uplink channels 48 to 55 (911.9 MHz to 913.3Mhz, 0.2MHz steps) and 1 downlink channel (926.9 MHz)
US 902-928 Sub-Band 8, uplink channels 56 to 63 (913.5 MHz to 914.9Mhz, 0.2MHz steps) and 1 downlink channel (927.5 MHz)
Keep M0+ active during system idle.
Put M0+ in Sleep mode during system idle.
Put M0+ in DeepSleep mode during system idle.

detaileddescription.para: Defines the mode that M0+ is in while M4 is working.

briefdescription.para: Do not wait till stack finished.
Wait while stack busy, M4 stays in Active mode.
M4 goes into Sleep while is stack busy.
M4 goes into DeepSleep while is stack busy.

detaileddescription.para: Defines the mode that M4 is in while M0+ is working.
Check your LoRa and/or LoRaWAN parameters/configuration.

briefdescription.para: MAC Busy Error, example, if lorawan_send and not waiting, lorawan mac cant be used because its still busy.
Channels Occupied Error, Duty Cycle Limit Reached.
Receive Window Timeout Error, if expecting a downlink (at confirmed upling you expect a conformation), rx timeout if no conformation.
Confirmation Error, the lorawan gateway can ask for redundancy, if redundancy, message is sent x times, up to 10 times, if sent x times and not confirmed, then this error sprungs.
Version mismatch error, change API version.
Sleep Mode, Fastest wake up, Highest consumption of all sleep modes.

detaileddescription.para: After wake up from this mode, the code continues normally from where it went to sleep.

briefdescription.para: Deep Sleep Mode, Lower power consumption than Sleep Mode, Best ration between power and ease of use.

detaileddescription.para: After wake up from this mode, the code continues normally from where it went to sleep.

briefdescription.para: Hibernates, WCO & RTC are shut down.

detaileddescription.para: After the module is woken up from Hibernate, it resets.
After the module is woken up from Hibernate, it resets. (RTC consumes approx. an additional .7uA)

briefdescription.para: Hibernates, RTC on, LoRaWAN MAC is saved to EEPROM and restored at wakeup.

detaileddescription.para: EEPROM USAGE = 0x1400.7800 - 0x1400.7FFF. After the module is woken up from Hibernate, it resets. (RTC consumes approx. an additional .7uA)
For current consumption please consult the datasheet found on our Github page.

briefdescription.para: Only ARM Cortex M0+ goes to sleep.
Only ARM Cortex M4 goes to sleep.
Only ARM Cortex M4 and M0+ goes to sleep.
Specifies the cores that go to sleep.
Both Link Check and Device Time Request MAC Commands.
LoRaWAN stack used on the module.

detaileddescription.para: Returned in coreInfo_t structure when LoRaWAN_GetInfo function is called.

briefdescription.para: This function forces the current non-blocking function to stop.

detaileddescription.para: Functions which receive waitMode_t can be set at both blocking and non-blocking.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the LoRaWAN stack and points the stack to the location of the settings.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure where Join, TXwhich sets the LoRaWAN parameters.

briefdescription.para: This function gives the stack information which were saved at the time of the programming.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the location where info will be saved.

briefdescription.para: Joins the LoRaWAN network, taking the parameters from the coreConfiguration structure which was passed to LoRaWAN_Init.

parameterdescription.para: Type of wait mode that the microcontroller core should wait in.

entry.para: Non-blocking. Do not wait untill stack is finished, M4 continues with operation.
Blocking. Wait while stack busy, M4 stays in Active mode.
Blocking. Wait while stack busy, M4 goes into Sleep while is stack busy.
Blocking. Wait while stack busy, M4 goes into DeepSleep while is stack busy.

briefdescription.para: This function reads the buffer that was previously saved to flash.

detaileddescription.para: This allows user to access the buffer even if reset or power off occures.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the buffer where the data read from flash will be saved to.
Block from which the data is read from. Available blocks: 0 to 7
Length of data which you wish to read. Maximum 255 bytes.

briefdescription.para: This function saves a buffer to flash.

detaileddescription.para: This allows user to access the buffer even if reset or power off occures.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the data which needs to be saved.
Block to which the data should be saved to. Available blocks: 0 to 7
Length of data which you wish saved. Maximum 255 bytes.

briefdescription.para: This function allows the user to set the current date and time.

parameterdescription.para: Point to the location where date and time data is saved.

briefdescription.para: This function allows the user to get the current date and time.

parameterdescription.para: Point to the location where date and time data is saved.

briefdescription.para: This function retrieves the specified length of data reveived via downlink from a gateway and saves it to a buffer.

detaileddescription.para: The lenght of data can be retrieved after a succesful LoRaWAN_Send, through the status structure it returns

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the byte buffer to which the data is retrieved to.
Length of data which you wish saved. The length of data received can be seen after LoRaWAN_Send in coreStatus.mac.bytesToRead

briefdescription.para: This function sends your buffer of data to the LoRaWAN network.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the data which needs to be sent.
Length of data which you wish to send.
Type of wait mode that the microcontroller core should wait in.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t *buffer, uint8_t length, WaitMode_e waitMode, MACcmd_e MACcmd)
memberdef.name: LoRaWAN_SendMac

briefdescription.para: This function sends your buffer of data and a MAC command to the LoRaWAN network.

detaileddescription.para: It is similar to LoRaWAN_Send, but this also sends a MAC command.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the data which needs to be sent.
Length of data which you wish to send.
Type of wait mode that the microcontroller core should wait in.
MAC command to be sent to the LoRaWAN network.

briefdescription.para: This function allows you to enter a sleep mode.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the sleep configuration structure.

briefdescription.para: This function returns the current error /status.
This function returns the current error /status.
